original_title: Parliamentary select committee seeks university Professors’ input on country’s bankruptcy
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Parliamentary Select Committee, tasked with investigating the reasons for Sri Lanka's bankruptcy, has decided to seek the expertise of university professors.
Sagara Kariyawasam, SLPP General Secretary and the committee's chairman, announced that they plan to hold discussions with heads of economics departments from various universities.

Kariyawasam emphasized the committee's primary goal of uncovering the true causes behind the country's bankruptcy. He intends to work closely with scholars to develop a comprehensive plan for this investigation. The committee aims to make recommendations to prevent similar financial crises from occurring in the future.
